evidence.text: Cty. of Riverside v. McLaughlin, 500 U.S. 44, 47 (1991)
Brown v. Sudduth, 675 F.3d 472, 477 (5th Cir. 2012)

Fifth Circuit Court ORDER - PER CURIAM Advising We GRANT the City's petition and VACATE the district court's 4/24/2019 and 5/24/2019 orders as they pertain to the documents contained in TAb 3 of Exhibit A. The City's Petition is DENIED in all other respects. We further REMAND this matter to the district court for further proceedings consistent with this opinion. (USCA No. 19-20377)

evidence.text: Settlement incorporated into court order; disputes would relate to decree enforcement, not settlement.
arrested without a warrant after December 5, 2014, and detained by the City of Houston for unreasonable periods of detention, without the requisite judicial probable cause determination.

whenever it takes longer than 48 hours to transfer such arrestees to the Harris County Jail, the City, as a matter of practice and custom, continues to detain the arrestees in its jail cells, without a neutral probable cause finding

extracted.value: Plaintiffs were arrested without a warrant after December 5, 2014, and detained by the City of Houston for unreasonable periods without probable cause determinations, including delays exceeding 48 hours for Class A and 24-48 hours for Class B, with transfers to Harris County Jail occurring after detention periods.
